questions.question_text_1: THIS IS QUESTION PAPER FOR THE SUBJECT "DEGREE LEVEL : DEEP LEARNING (COMPUTER BASED EXAM)" ARE YOU SURE YOU HAVE TO WRITE EXAM FOR THIS SUBJECT? CROSS CHECK YOUR HALL TICKET TO CONFIRM THE SUBJECTS TO BE WRITTEN. (IF IT IS NOT THE CORRECT SUBJECT, PLS CHECK THE SECTION AT THE TOP FOR THE SUBJECTS REGISTERED BY YOU)
question_texts: THIS IS QUESTION PAPER FOR THE SUBJECT "DEGREE LEVEL : DEEP LEARNING (COMPUTER BASED EXAM)" ARE YOU SURE YOU HAVE TO WRITE EXAM FOR THIS SUBJECT? CROSS CHECK YOUR HALL TICKET TO CONFIRM THE SUBJECTS TO BE WRITTEN. (IF IT IS NOT THE CORRECT SUBJECT, PLS CHECK THE SECTION AT THE TOP FOR THE SUBJECTS REGISTERED BY YOU)

questions.question_text_1: The statement that the bias correction in ADAM optimizer is an absolute requirement for it to converge to a local minimum is
question_texts: The statement that the bias correction in ADAM optimizer is an absolute requirement for it to converge to a local minimum is

options.option_text: both the bias and variance of the model become zero
model has zero bias and non-zero variance
model has non-zero bias and non-zero variance

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following optimization algorithms adapts the learning rate based on the current gradient and history of gradients?
question_texts: Which of the following optimization algorithms adapts the learning rate based on the current gradient and history of gradients?

options.option_text: Gradient Descent with exponentially decaying learning rate
Nesterov Accelerated Gradient Descent with step decay

questions.question_text_1: In general, applying regularization to an over-fitted deep learning model
question_texts: In general, applying regularization to an over-fitted deep learning model

options.option_text: decreases the training error of the over-parameterized model
increases the training error of the over-parameterized model
reduces the testing error of the over-parameterized model
improves the generalization ability of the over-parameterized model

questions.question_text_1: Assume a team has trained a CNN model for image classification. They observed that the model was performing poorly (that is, both training and testing errors were high). Which of the following would be a more appropriate measure that might improve the performance of the model?
question_texts: Assume a team has trained a CNN model for image classification. They observed that the model was performing poorly (that is, both training and testing errors were high). Which of the following would be a more appropriate measure that might improve the performance of the model?

options.option_text: increase the model complexity by adding more layers (therefore, moreparameters)
decrease the model complexity by removing a few layers
